It's so cringeworthy to listen to those who defend the Riot-as-Nanny approach to the community try to describe the behavior they dislike.  "Toxic."  It's so overused, it means nothing anymore.

There's a huge difference between someone being openly and consistently racist or homophobic or hateful towards others, and being critical about another's performance in game.  One is never warranted, the other may be completely accurate, even by the subject's own standards.  Players should be allowed to express displeasure at their peers' performance, because it's a competitive game.  Anything else sets a sliding standard where even a constructive comment like, "Hey, you seem new to this matchup.  Maybe I can give you some pointers," is ultimately punishable by the permanent suspension of the commentator's account because it's "passive aggressive," or "arrogant," or some other absurd ad hoc justification.

If someone says something about your play that upsets you, frankly, that's too damn bad.  Maybe they're wrong, maybe they're right, but you can't control their opinion, only your own reception of it.  Get better, or consider that opinion worthless, or both, but deal with it.  That's how competition in the real world works, and to create an environment in this game that is not consistent with this is a huge disservice to the community.

Mute button isn't a fix for anything.
It's a temporary measure to ensure your experience in a game isn't ruined further by an asshole who likes his keyboard a little too much. Reporting and blocking a player is also a temporary measure and is a part of a solution, where removing a player from the community is the last resort.

Having a mute button and a curse filter is not a reason for you to be an asshole or to excessively curse. If you, as a toxic asshole, know you can't converse with people on a normal level, you can also not use the chat and strictly rely on pings. That way, you can shout to your heart's content in your room about your teammates being scrublords and boosted animals, as long as it doesn't find the way into the game.
But we all know that resisting the urge to type shit in chat is impossible so we have tools for dealing with it, not fixing it.
